definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: Young couple be smooching all over campus after finishing finals.
sentences.chinese: 期末考結束後，年輕愛侶在校園各處熱烈擁吻。

sentences.english: Respect your spouse's right to privacy; individual space is important.
sentences.chinese: 尊重愛侶的私密，親暱的關係更需要空間。

sentences.english: It carries the scent of honeysuckle, sweet as the lover's kiss.
sentences.chinese: 吐息輕攜着忍冬的芬芳，香若愛侶的蜜吻。

sentences.english: It happens with friends and family, too.
sentences.chinese: 不僅在愛侶之間，在朋友或家人之間也存在這一現象。

sentences.english: Tell your partner about the options you found for where to go.
sentences.chinese: 告訴你的愛侶你找到的去哪裏做檢查的選擇。

sentences.english: Are you two lovebirds evey going to get married?
sentences.chinese: 你們這對甜蜜愛侶打不打算結婚呀？

sentences.english: Ask if your partner has ever had an STD that he or she knows about.
sentences.chinese: 問清楚你的愛侶是否清楚他或她有過性病。

sentences.english: After you introduce the topic, pause to hear what your partner says.
sentences.chinese: 在你引入了這個話題後，停下來聽聽你的愛侶怎麼說。

sentences.english: Listening also gives you clues to what your partner thinks.
sentences.chinese: 聆聽也能夠幫你瞭解你的愛侶的想法。

sentences.english: Or flitting among the trees of the apple-orchard, building the nest of his mate.
sentences.chinese: 或在蘋果園的樹木中飛動，給它的愛侶築巢。

sentences.english: And yet, by heaven, I think my love as rare.
sentences.chinese: 可是，我敢指天發誓，我的愛侶。

sentences.english: You don't want to have to be the man and the woman in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 你們並不想被所謂的愛侶關係束縛。

sentences.english: While the maiden was full of fiery passion treated him as her lover.
sentences.chinese: 那少女更是熱情如火，將虛竹當作了愛侶。

definition: in love with/to feel deeply attached to
to whisper in sb's ear/a whisper
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
lit. a pair of birds flying close together (idiom)/fig. two hearts beating as one/name of a sweet and sour chicken wing dish
ordinary and mediocre (idiom); nothing to write home about
